intro: Chaerophyllum argenteum, commonly known as silver avens, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, white or yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It has a creeping rootstock and can form dense mats, making it a common ground cover in its native habitat. Its silver-gray foliage gives it a distinctive appearance, and it is often used in ornamental gardening.
